name: Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)
description: Ranked #1 globally for 13 consecutive years, MIT is known for extreme academic rigor and breakthrough innovation. Located next to Harvard, MIT drives research that shapes modern technology and industry.

name: Harvard University
description: The oldest US university, Harvard holds the world's largest academic endowment and a global network of influential alumni. It ranks extremely high across nearly every major ranking system.

name: University of Cambridge
description: Founded in 1209, Cambridge is one of the world's oldest institutions and consistently ranks in the global top tier with deep research strength.

name: University of Oxford
description: The oldest English-speaking university, Oxford operates through 38 colleges and is known for personalized "tutorial" teaching.

name: Stanford University
description: Located in Silicon Valley, Stanford is tightly connected with the tech industry and acts as a major engine for global entrepreneurship.

name: Imperial College London
description: A STEM-exclusive university known for rapidly converting research into real-world applications.

name: University of California, Berkeley
description: A top global public university, known for excellence across sciences, economics, engineering, and activism-driven history.

name: Princeton University
description: A member of the historic "Big Three," Princeton emphasizes undergraduate education and high research output per capita.

name: California Institute of Technology (Caltech)
description: A small STEM-focused university producing extremely high research output relative to size.

name: Columbia University
description: A major Ivy League institution with global impact in journalism, law, medicine, and public health.

name: University of Chicago
description: Known for academic intensity, especially in economics, law, and theoretical sciences.

name: Yale University
description: Renowned for arts, law, humanities, and its residential college system.

name: Cornell University
description: Offers one of the broadest subject ranges in the Ivy League, including unique land-grant programs.

name: University of Pennsylvania (UPenn)
description: Founded by Benjamin Franklin, known for professional schools and practical education.

name: University College London (UCL)
description: A huge research powerhouse known for inclusivity and strong global research impact.

name: Johns Hopkins University
description: Globally dominant in medical and public health research; the first US research university.

name: University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA)
description: A major UC campus with excellence in arts, sciences, and engineering.

name: ETH Zurich
description: Europe's top technical university, alma mater of Einstein.

name: Tsinghua University
description: Asia's #1 in ARWU, widely known as the "MIT of China."

name: National University of Singapore (NUS)
description: A globally competitive institution with strong industry integration.

name: University of Tokyo
description: Japan's most prestigious university.

name: University of Edinburgh
description: A historic research institution with strong computational and medical strength.

name: Paris-Saclay University
description: A newly consolidated group of elite French institutions that rapidly rose in global rankings.

name: University of Michigan – Ann Arbor
description: A top public university with broad research power.

name: McGill University
description: One of Canada's most internationally known universities.

name: École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL)
description: A major technical university focused on innovation and engineering.

name: University of Toronto
description: Canada's largest and most influential research university.

name: Peking University
description: Known for excellence in humanities and social sciences; strong historical influence.

name: University of Melbourne
description: Australia's #1 university with excellent global employability outcomes.

name: King's College London (KCL)
description: A historic institution with strong influence in medicine and global policy studies.
